intro: Oxybaphus pratensis, commonly known as the meadow oxybaphus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a mild, aromatic scent. Oxybaphus pratensis is often found in temperate regions of Europe and is known for its ecological importance to pollinators.
